lines.text: Ah, you're just like your mother. I've done everything in the world for the both of ya'. I guess we just don't talk the same language any more.
To speak any language, daddy, you have to start early and practice often.

[Dancing drunkily with his wife Jackie]
I adore you, baby. Adore you. Need you baby. Want you now. Be good to me baby. Be good...
[He falls to the couch]
The whole world is whirling, whirling, whirling... Hold me, baby. Help me. Kiss me.
[He passes out]
You want to be treated like a man? Act like one.
What kind of car was he driving?
I don't know. I don't judge people by their cars.
We've been in this neighborhood too long.
I like it here.
Why not? Around here where the only real religion is keeping up with the Jones. You're a Jones.
And you're Mrs. Jones.
You know what, Betty? You're getting old.
I wish I could say the same for you.
We have become a nation of Peeping Toms. No longer participating in life but getting your little pleasures by watching others.
When you're ready to play in the big league, give me a call.
Go to hell!
So pin me. You think I finally made varsity. So where's my big red "A"?
Oh sure, it's just a big joke to you isn't it?
For a while I was up to bat swinging from my heels. But I didn't really earn my scarlet letter. In fact, I settled for ice coffee.
Did you ever do something you couldn't help doing... like step in every square of a sidewalk?
Touch every post on a fence? There was a time... when I was little.
Did you ever have something terrible happen and everything goes blurred and rushed 'til you can't stop and all of a sudden you're doing the one thing you swore you'd never do again?

[Tipsy]
If that's ginger ale, I'm Little Orphan Annie.
Goodbye, Gareth. I hope you'll be happy.
With money, who needs happiness?
